titles: Paidōn nosēmata· = or Childrens diseases both outward and inward. From the time of their birth to fourteen years of age. With their natures, causes, signs, presages and cures. In three books: 1. Of external 2. Universal 3. Inward diseases. Also, the resolutions of many profitable questions concerning children, and of nurses, and of nursing children. By J. S. physician.
author: J. S.
Vaughan, William, fl. 1664, engraver.
publisher: printed by W.G. and are to be sold by J. Playford and Zach. Watkins at their shop in the Temple near the Church,
notes: The first two words of title are in Greek characters.
The words "1. .. diseases." are connected by a complex system of brackets on title page.
Engraved frontispiece is signed: Giu. Vaughan fecit.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Children --  Diseases --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Disease --  Causes and theories of causation --  Early works to 1800.
